alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:09AM EDT until July 14 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT FOR MORRIS...SOUTH CENTRAL SUSSEX...EAST CENTRAL WARREN AND NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET COUNTIES... At 709 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Budd Lake to near Mendham to near Millington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Madison, Hopatcong, Florham Park, East Hanover, Hackettstown, Chatham, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Stanhope, Netcong, Peapack And Gladstone, Chester and Victory Gardens. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 40 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 21 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 28 and 49. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
